sentences: Kirk R. Thatcher (born February 14, 1962) is an American writer, producer, television and film director, an Internet video director, and a production designer.
Thatcher was born and raised in Los Angeles, California.
Thatcher was the production designer on David Fincher's first music videos and spent over a year creating the look for a number of Rick Springfield and The Motels videos.
Thatcher's first directorial effort was in 2002, with It's a Very Merry Muppet Christmas Movie for NBC, which drew more than 11 million viewers.

Thatcher has co-written several Muppet films including Muppet Treasure Island (1996) and directed three television movies, including A Muppets Christmas: Letters to Santa (2008) and The Muppets' Wizard of Oz (2005), which premiered at Robert De Niro's Tribeca Film Festival.
In 2015, Thatcher directed Turkey Hollow, a Thanksgiving-themed TV movie for The Jim Henson Company which aired on Lifetime.
Kirk Thatcher makes a cameo appearance as "Punk Rock Guy" in the 2017 film Spider-Man: Homecoming, as a homage to his role as "Punk on Bus" in Star Trek IV:
In October 2021, Thatcher wrote and directed Muppets Haunted Mansion.
Kirk Thatcher was a supervising producer on the Emmy Award-winning ABC series Muppets Tonight.
In 2014, Thatcher was seen on the SyFy Network's series Jim Henson's Creature Shop Challenge where he appeared in each episode, filling the role of a judge for the competition.
He has also directed 2015 Muppet Music videos "Jungle Boogie" and "Kodachrome."
